intro: Ruyschia corallina, commonly known as the coral ruyschia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, coral-like inflorescences. The plant features strap-shaped leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ruyschia corallina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
